problem_text: In Figure, a cockroach with mass $m$ rides on a disk of mass $6.00 \mathrm{~m}$ and radius $R$. The disk rotates like a merry-go-round around its central axis at angular speed $\omega_i=1.50 \mathrm{rad} / \mathrm{s}$. The cockroach is initially at radius $r=0.800 R$, but then it crawls out to the rim of the disk. Treat the cockroach as a particle. What then is the angular speed?
